net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class ReferenceText

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.Text
        • net.cloud.gfx.elements.ReferenceText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable

    public class ReferenceText
extends Text
    For when some text element will need to be updated, but there is no convenient event to base the text update on. This element requires a Supplier to determine what the text should be. The Supplier does not necessarily have to provide a new String each request - in fact if possible it is safe to return getText() when a new String is not needed to avoid initialization costs.

    • Field Detail

      • reference

        private java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> reference
        What we'll be getting our new strings from

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReferenceText

        public ReferenceText(java.lang.String text,
                     java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> reference)
        Create a new Reference text object which will initially display the given text, and use the given Supplier to obtain updated text strings. The color and font are left as default.
        Parameters:
        text - Initial text
        reference - Supplies updated text

      • ReferenceText

        public ReferenceText(java.lang.String text,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> reference)
        Create a new Reference text object which will initially display the given text, and use the given Supplier to obtain updated text strings. The color and font are left as default. The string's top left edge will be at the given position.
        Parameters:
        text - Initial text
        x - The x-position. The left edge of the text
        y - The y-position. The top edge of the text
        reference - Supplies updated text

      • ReferenceText

        public ReferenceText(java.lang.String text,
                     int priority,
                     int x,
                     int y,
                     java.awt.Font font,
                     java.awt.Color color,
                     java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> reference)
        Create a new Reference text object which will initially display the given text, and use the given Supplier to obtain updated text strings. The color and font are also specified. The position will be the top left edge of the text.
        Parameters:
        text - Initial text
        priority - The z-priority
        x - The x-position. The left edge of the text
        y - The y-position. The top edge of the text
        font - Initial font
        color - Initial color
        reference - Supplies updated text

    • Method Detail

      • drawElement

        public void drawElement(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Draw the text in the desired font and color at the position. The text will be drawn by the top left corner, rather than baseline. Before drawing, the supplier will be queried for an updated text string.
        Specified by:
        drawElement in interface Element
        Overrides:
        drawElement in class Text
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to
        offsetX - How far off on the X axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        offsetY - How far off on the Y axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If there was an issue iterating child elements

      • getReference

        public java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getReference()
        Returns:
        The Function that is providing new strings

        public void setReference(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> reference)
        Parameters:
        reference - A new Function to provide text strings
